title: Projects
text:
Here’s a showcase of my recent projects and work. Each project represents a unique challenge and learning experience.


Explore the projects below to see what I’ve been working on. From web applications to data analysis, each project demonstrates different skills and technologies.

title: Projects
text: Explore the projects below to see what I’ve been working on. From web applications to data analysis, each project demonstrates different skills and technologies.

title: Modern Web Application
text: This project is a modern web application that demonstrates best practices in full-stack development. It features a responsive design, user authentication, and real-time data updates.

title: Modern Web Application
text: This project is a modern web application that demonstrates best practices in full-stack development. It features a responsive design, user authentication, and real-time data updates.

title: Modern Web Application
text:
Key Features

Responsive Design: Works seamlessly across all devices
User Authentication: Secure login and registration system
Real-time Updates: Live data synchronization using WebSockets
Modern Stack: Built with React, Node.js, Express, and MongoDB

title: Modern Web Application
text:
Technologies Used


Frontend - React - TypeScript - Tailwind CSS


Backend - Node.js - Express - MongoDB


Tools - Git - Docker - Jest


Deployment - Vercel - MongoDB Atlas - GitHub Actions

title: Modern Web Application
text:
Challenges & Solutions
One of the main challenges was implementing real-time updates efficiently. We solved this by using WebSockets for live data synchronization, which significantly improved the user experience.

title: Modern Web Application
text:
Demo & Code

GitHub Repository: View Code

title: Modern Web Application
text:
What I Learned
This project taught me the importance of: - Planning architecture before coding - Writing clean, maintainable code - Testing throughout the development process - Optimizing for performance from the start

Project completed: October 2025

title: Getting Started with Quarto
text:
Quarto is an amazing tool for creating scientific and technical documents, websites, and presentations. In this post, we’ll explore some of its key features.


Quarto offers several advantages:

Multi-Format Output: Create HTML, PDF, Word documents, and more from a single source
Beautiful Defaults: Modern, professional-looking output out of the box
Code Integration: Seamlessly integrate code from Python, R, Julia, and other languages
Markdown-Based: Simple, readable syntax that’s easy to learn




To create a new Quarto project, simply install Quarto and run:
quarto create project website mysite





Quarto supports syntax highlighting for many languages:
def hello_world():
    print("Hello from Quarto!")
    
hello_world()



Use callouts to highlight important information:






WarningImportant Note



Always test your code before publishing!





Create sophisticated layouts using Quarto’s grid system and divs.




Quarto is a powerful tool for creating modern, professional content. We’ll explore more advanced features in future posts.




Quarto Documentation
Quarto Gallery

title: Welcome to My Blog
text:
I’m excited to launch this blog. This space will be dedicated to sharing insights, tutorials, and updates about data science, analytics, and technology projects.


In the coming weeks and months, you can expect:

Technical Tutorials: Step-by-step guides on various technologies
Project Updates: News about what we’re working on
Industry Insights: Our thoughts on trends and developments
Community Highlights: Showcasing contributions from our community




Make sure to check back regularly for new content. We’re committed to providing valuable information and fostering a community of learners and creators.






TipSubscribe to Updates



Don’t miss a post! Follow us on social media to get notified when we publish new content.


Thank you for joining us on this journey!

title: Data Analysis Dashboard
text: This data analysis dashboard provides interactive visualizations and insights from complex datasets. It’s designed to make data exploration intuitive and accessible.

title: Data Analysis Dashboard
text: This data analysis dashboard provides interactive visualizations and insights from complex datasets. It’s designed to make data exploration intuitive and accessible.

title: Data Analysis Dashboard
text:
Key Features

Interactive Visualizations: Dynamic charts and graphs using Plotly
Data Processing: Efficient data handling with Pandas
Real-time Filtering: Interactive filters for data exploration
Export Options: Export reports in multiple formats

title: Data Analysis Dashboard
text:
Technologies Used
# Core libraries used in this project
import pandas as pd
import plotly.express as px
import dash
from dash import dcc, html
Tech Stack: - Python 3.11 - Pandas for data manipulation - Plotly & Dash for visualizations - NumPy for numerical computations

title: Data Analysis Dashboard
text:
Project Highlights

Data Processing Pipeline
The dashboard processes large datasets efficiently using:

Data Cleaning: Automated preprocessing and validation
Transformation: Feature engineering and aggregation
Visualization: Multiple chart types and interactive elements



Performance Optimization

Implemented caching for faster load times
Optimized queries for large datasets
Used lazy loading for better UX

title: Data Analysis Dashboard
text:
Use Cases
This dashboard has been used for: - Business intelligence reporting - Sales data analysis - Customer behavior tracking - Performance metrics monitoring






TipTry It Out



The dashboard is designed to work with various data sources. You can connect your own CSV files or databases to visualize your data.

title: Data Analysis Dashboard
text:
Code Sample
Here’s an example of creating an interactive visualization:
def create_chart(df, x_col, y_col):
    fig = px.scatter(df, x=x_col, y=y_col, 
                     title=f'{y_col} vs {x_col}',
                     hover_data=df.columns)
    return fig

title: Talks & Presentations
text:
I enjoy sharing knowledge and insights with the community through talks, workshops, and presentations. Here’s a collection of my speaking engagements.





Conference: Tech Summit 2025
Date: October 15, 2025
Location: Virtual
An overview of modern web development practices, including React, TypeScript, and best practices for building scalable applications.






NoteResources




Slides (PDF)
Video Recording
Code Examples







Event: Data Science Meetup
Date: August 22, 2025
Location: San Francisco, CA
Exploring techniques for creating effective data visualizations that tell compelling stories and drive insights.
Key Topics: - Choosing the right chart type - Color theory for data viz - Interactive vs. static visualizations - Tools and libraries overview






NoteResources




Slides (PDF)
Demo Code







Event: Developer Bootcamp
Date: June 10, 2025
Location: Virtual
A hands-on workshop covering RESTful API development, authentication, and deployment best practices.
What Attendees Learned: - REST API fundamentals - Express.js framework - Database integration - Security best practices - Testing and deployment






NoteResources




Workshop Materials
GitHub Repository










Conference: WebDev Conference 2024
Date: November 5, 2024
Location: New York, NY
Participated in a panel discussion about emerging trends and the future direction of web development technologies.




Event: Local Tech Meetup
Date: September 18, 2024
Location: Seattle, WA
A 15-minute lightning talk sharing practical tips for maintaining high code quality in fast-paced development environments.





I’m available to speak on the following topics:


Web Development - Modern JavaScript/TypeScript - React and frontend frameworks - Performance optimization - Responsive design


Data Science - Data visualization - Python for data analysis - Machine learning basics - Statistical analysis


Best Practices - Code quality and testing - CI/CD pipelines - Developer productivity - Technical documentation






I’m always interested in speaking opportunities! If you’d like me to speak at your event, please reach out.






TipContact




Email: speaking@example.com
Topics: See above or suggest your own
Format: Talks, workshops, panels, or podcasts

Note: Replace with your actual contact information.






Looking for older presentations? Check out my GitHub repository where I archive all presentation materials, slides, and code examples.

title: About
text:
I’m a data analyst/scientist currently working at Exact in the Netherlands. Before that, I worked as a researcher at the University of Twente. Welcome to my personal website!




I specialize in full-stack development and data science, with a particular interest in creating intuitive user experiences and deriving insights from data.



Building modern web applications with cutting-edge technologies. I focus on clean code, scalability, and user experience.
Technologies: - JavaScript/TypeScript - React, Node.js - Python - Databases & APIs



Transforming data into actionable insights through analysis and visualization. I love finding patterns and telling stories with data.
Skills: - Data analysis - Machine learning - Visualization - Statistical modeling



Sharing knowledge through talks, workshops, and writing. I believe in giving back to the community and helping others grow.
Topics: - Web development - Data visualization - Best practices - Career development






Education: - University of Twente - Researcher
Experience: - Data Analyst/Scientist at Exact (Present) - Researcher at University of Twente (Previously)




When I’m not coding or analyzing data, you can find me:

 Reading about technology and science
 Hiking and exploring nature
 Photography
 Listening to music and podcasts
 Trying new coffee shops






[Award Name] - [Organization], 2024
Published Article - “[Article Title]” in [Publication]
Open Source Contributor - [Project Names]
Community Leader - Organized [Event/Meetup]





I’m always interested in connecting with fellow developers, data enthusiasts, and interesting people. Feel free to reach out!






NoteContact Information




 GitHub: github.com/mcnakhaee
 Twitter: @m_cnakhaee
 LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/muhammadcnakhaee
 Instagram: @mcnakhaee








This website is built using Quarto, a modern scientific and technical publishing system. Previously, I used the {distill} package and Hugo with the blogdown package.






TipLet’s Connect!



I’m always interested in connecting with fellow data scientists, developers, and researchers. Feel free to reach out through any of my social channels!
